American.title: Classic Cheeseburger
American.instructions: Form ground beef into 4 patties and season with salt and pepper. Cook on grill or skillet for 4-5 minutes per side. Toast buns with butter. Assemble burgers with cheese, onion, tomato, lettuce, and condiments. Serve hot with fries.

American.title: BBQ Ribs
American.instructions: Mix dry spices and rub on ribs. Let marinate for 2 hours. Preheat oven to 275°F. Wrap ribs in foil and bake for 2.5 hours. Remove foil, brush with BBQ sauce, and bake for 30 minutes. Serve with coleslaw and cornbread.

American.title: Mac and Cheese
American.instructions: Cook macaroni according to package directions. Make roux with butter and flour. Add milk gradually, stirring constantly. Add cheeses and seasonings. Mix with cooked pasta. Top with breadcrumbs and melted butter. Bake at 375°F for 25 minutes until golden.

American.title: Fried Chicken
American.instructions: Mix flour with spices. Beat eggs with buttermilk. Dredge chicken in flour, dip in egg mixture, then flour again. Heat oil to 350°F and fry chicken for 12-15 minutes until golden and cooked through. Drain on paper towels and serve hot.

American.title: Buffalo Wings
American.instructions: Bake wings at 400°F for 45 minutes until crispy. Mix hot sauce, butter, vinegar, and spices. Toss wings in sauce. Serve with blue cheese dressing and celery/carrot sticks.

American.title: Clam Chowder
American.instructions: Cook bacon until crispy. Add onion and celery, cook until soft. Add potatoes and clam juice. Simmer until potatoes are tender. Make roux with butter and flour. Add milk and cream gradually. Add clams and seasonings. Simmer for 10 minutes. Garnish with parsley.

American.title: Meatloaf
American.instructions: Mix all ingredients except glaze. Form into loaf shape. Bake at 350°F for 1 hour. Mix brown sugar and ketchup for glaze. Brush over meatloaf and bake for 15 minutes more. Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing.

American.title: Apple Pie
American.instructions: Mix apples with sugar, flour, and spices. Line pie pan with one crust. Add apple mixture and dot with butter. Cover with second crust and seal edges. Brush with beaten egg and sprinkle with sugar. Bake at 425°F for 15 minutes, then 350°F for 35 minutes.

American.title: Pancakes
American.instructions: Mix dry ingredients. Beat eggs with milk, butter, and vanilla. Combine wet and dry ingredients. Cook on griddle with butter until bubbles form. Flip and cook until golden. Serve with maple syrup and butter.

American.title: Chicken and Waffles
American.instructions: Marinate chicken in buttermilk for 2 hours. Mix flour with spices. Dredge chicken and fry until golden. For waffles, mix dry ingredients. Beat eggs with milk and butter. Combine and cook in waffle iron. Serve chicken over waffles with maple syrup.

American.title: Caesar Salad
American.instructions: Wash and chop lettuce. Mix all dressing ingredients. Toss lettuce with dressing. Add croutons and Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

American.title: Chili Con Carne
ingredients: Shredded cheese and sour cream for serving
American.instructions: Brown ground beef with onion and garlic. Add tomatoes, beans, and seasonings. Add broth and simmer for 1 hour. Serve with cheese and sour cream.

American.title: Pot Roast
American.instructions: Season roast with salt and pepper. Brown in oil on all sides. Add vegetables, broth, wine, and Worcestershire sauce. Cover and cook at 325°F for 3 hours until tender. Serve with pan juices.

American.title: Cobb Salad
American.instructions: Arrange lettuce on platter. Arrange chicken, bacon, eggs, avocado, tomatoes, and blue cheese in rows. Drizzle with vinaigrette and season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

American.title: Key Lime Pie
American.instructions: Mix crumbs with sugar and butter. Press into pie pan and bake at 350°F for 10 minutes. Beat egg yolks with condensed milk, lime juice, and zest. Pour into crust and bake for 15 minutes. Cool and chill. Whip cream with powdered sugar and top pie. Garnish with lime slices.

American.title: Cornbread
American.instructions: Mix dry ingredients. Beat egg with milk, butter, and honey. Combine wet and dry ingredients. Pour into greased 9-inch pan. Bake at 400°F for 20-25 minutes until golden. Serve warm with butter.

American.title: Pulled Pork
American.instructions: Season pork with spices. Place in slow cooker with onion and garlic. Mix BBQ sauce, brown sugar, and vinegar. Pour over pork. Cook on low for 8 hours. Shred pork and mix with sauce. Serve on buns.

American.title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
American.instructions: Mix flour, baking soda, and salt. Cream butter with sugars. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Gradually add flour mixture. Stir in chocolate chips and nuts. Drop onto baking sheets. Bake at 375°F for 9-11 minutes until golden.

American.title: New York Cheesecake
American.instructions: Mix crumbs with sugar and butter. Press into springform pan. Beat cream cheese with sugar. Add sour cream and vanilla. Beat in eggs one at a time. Add flour. Pour into crust. Bake at 325°F for 1 hour. Cool and chill overnight. Garnish with berries.

American.title: Crab Cakes
American.instructions: Mix crabmeat with breadcrumbs, mayonnaise, egg, mustard, Worcestershire, lemon juice, and seasonings. Form into patties. Chill for 30 minutes. Cook in butter for 4-5 minutes per side until golden. Serve with lemon wedges.

American.title: Quick Scrambled Eggs
American.instructions: Beat eggs with milk, salt, and pepper. Heat butter in pan over medium heat. Add eggs and scramble gently for 2-3 minutes until set. Garnish with chives and serve immediately.

American.title: Microwave Oatmeal
American.instructions: Combine oats and milk in microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on high for 2 minutes. Stir in honey and cinnamon. Top with berries and nuts. Serve hot.

American.title: Avocado Toast
American.instructions: Toast bread slices. Mash avocado with lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Spread on toast. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with red pepper flakes. Serve immediately.

American.title: Quick Smoothie Bowl
American.instructions: Blend banana, berries, yogurt, milk, and honey until smooth. Pour into bowl. Top with granola and fresh fruit. Serve immediately.

American.title: Instant Ramen Upgrade
American.instructions: Cook ramen according to package directions. Add spinach in last minute. Poach egg in broth. Top with soy sauce, sesame oil, green onion, and sriracha. Serve hot.

American.title: Quick Quesadilla
ingredients: Salsa and sour cream for serving
American.instructions: Heat butter in pan. Place one tortilla, add cheese, beans, and corn. Top with second tortilla. Cook for 2-3 minutes per side until golden and cheese melts. Cut into wedges and serve with salsa and sour cream.

American.title: Microwave Mug Cake
American.instructions: Mix dry ingredients in microwave-safe mug. Add wet ingredients and stir until smooth. Add chocolate chips. Microwave on high for 1-2 minutes until cake rises. Let cool slightly and enjoy.

American.title: Quick BLT Sandwich
American.instructions: Cook bacon until crispy. Toast bread slices. Spread mayonnaise on bread. Layer lettuce, tomato, and bacon. Season with salt and pepper. Close sandwich and serve immediately.

American.title: Grilled Cheese Sandwich
American.instructions: Butter one side of each bread slice. Place cheese between bread slices. Cook in pan over medium heat for 3-4 minutes per side until golden and cheese melts. Serve with tomato soup.

American.title: Quick Chicken Salad
American.instructions: Mix chicken with mayonnaise, celery, grapes, and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper. Chill for 10 minutes. Serve on lettuce leaves or in sandwiches.

American.title: Quick Pasta with Marinara
American.instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions. Heat olive oil and sauté garlic for 1 minute. Add marinara sauce and simmer for 5 minutes. Toss with cooked pasta. Top with Parmesan and basil. Season with salt and pepper.

American.title: Quick Stir-Fry
American.instructions: Heat oil in wok or large pan. Stir-fry chicken for 5 minutes. Add vegetables and cook for 3 minutes. Add garlic, ginger, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Cook for 2 minutes. Serve over rice.

American.title: Quick Fish Tacos
American.instructions: Season fish with cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Cook fish for 3-4 minutes per side. Warm tortillas. Mix sour cream with lime juice. Assemble tacos with fish, cabbage, and sour cream mixture. Garnish with cilantro.

American.title: Quick Beef Stir-Fry
American.instructions: Heat oil in wok. Stir-fry beef for 4 minutes. Add vegetables and cook for 3 minutes. Add garlic, soy sauce, and oyster sauce. Cook for 2 minutes. Serve over rice.

American.title: Quick Shrimp Scampi
American.instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions. Melt butter and sauté garlic for 1 minute. Add shrimp and cook for 3 minutes. Add wine and lemon juice. Simmer for 2 minutes. Toss with pasta and parsley. Season with salt and pepper.

American.title: Quick Chicken Quesadillas
American.instructions: Heat butter in pan. Place tortilla, add chicken, cheese, and salsa. Top with second tortilla. Cook for 3-4 minutes per side until golden. Cut into wedges. Serve with sour cream and cilantro.

American.title: Instant Grilled Cheese
American.instructions: Butter bread slices. Place cheese between bread. Heat pan and cook sandwich for 3 minutes per side until golden and cheese melts. Serve hot.

American.title: Quick BLT Sandwich
American.instructions: Cook bacon in pan for 4 minutes per side until crispy. Toast bread. Spread mayonnaise on bread. Layer bacon, tomato, and lettuce. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

American.title: Speedy Pancakes
American.instructions: Mix dry ingredients. Beat egg with milk and butter. Combine wet and dry ingredients. Heat griddle and cook pancakes for 2 minutes per side. Serve with maple syrup.

American.title: Quick Beef Tacos
American.instructions: Cook ground beef in pan for 5 minutes. Add taco seasoning and cook for 2 minutes. Heat taco shells. Fill with beef, cheese, tomato, and lettuce. Top with sour cream.

American.title: Instant French Toast
American.instructions: Beat eggs with milk, vanilla, and cinnamon. Dip bread in mixture. Heat butter in pan and cook bread for 3 minutes per side until golden. Serve with maple syrup.

American.title: Quick Meatloaf
American.instructions: Mix all ingredients in bowl. Form into loaf. Bake at 375°F for 25 minutes. Brush with ketchup and bake 5 more minutes. Let rest 5 minutes before slicing.

American.title: Speedy Scrambled Eggs
American.instructions: Beat eggs with milk, salt, and pepper. Heat butter in pan. Add eggs and cook, stirring constantly, for 3 minutes until set. Garnish with chives and serve hot.

American.title: Quick Chicken Noodle Soup
American.instructions: Bring broth to boil. Add noodles and cook for 8 minutes. Add chicken, carrot, and celery. Cook for 5 minutes. Season with thyme, salt, and pepper. Serve hot.

American.title: Instant Hash Browns
American.instructions: Heat butter in pan. Add potatoes and press down. Cook for 5 minutes without stirring. Flip and cook for 5 more minutes until golden. Season with salt, pepper, and paprika.

American.title: Quick BBQ Chicken
American.instructions: Season chicken with garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Heat oil in pan and cook chicken for 6 minutes per side. Brush with BBQ sauce and cook for 2 more minutes. Serve hot.

American.title: Speedy Corn on the Cob
American.instructions: Boil corn in water for 8 minutes. Drain and brush with butter. Season with salt, pepper, and paprika. Serve immediately.

American.title: Quick Apple Pie
American.instructions: Mix apples with sugar and cinnamon. Place in pie crust. Dot with butter. Cover with second crust and seal edges. Brush with egg. Bake at 425°F for 15 minutes, then 350°F for 25 minutes.

American.title: Instant Chocolate Chip Cookies
American.instructions: Cream butter and sugars. Beat in egg and vanilla. Mix in flour and baking soda. Fold in chocolate chips. Drop onto baking sheet. Bake at 375°F for 10 minutes. Cool on wire rack.

American.title: Quick Caesar Salad
American.instructions: Chop lettuce and place in bowl. Add dressing and toss. Top with Parmesan cheese and croutons. Season with black pepper. Serve immediately.

American.title: Speedy Beef Stew
American.instructions: Brown beef in pot for 5 minutes. Add broth and bring to boil. Add vegetables and thyme. Simmer for 20 minutes until tender. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

American.title: Quick Fish and Chips
American.instructions: Dredge fish in flour, dip in egg, then coat with breadcrumbs. Heat oil and fry fish for 4 minutes per side. Fry potatoes for 8 minutes until golden. Season with salt and pepper.

American.title: Instant Mac and Cheese
American.instructions: Cook macaroni according to package. Make roux with butter and flour. Add milk and cook until thickened. Add cheese and stir until melted. Mix with macaroni. Season with salt and pepper.

American.title: Quick Pulled Pork
American.instructions: Season pork with garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Place in slow cooker with BBQ sauce and vinegar. Cook on high for 4 hours. Shred pork and mix with sauce. Serve on buns.

American.cooking_instructions: Preheat grill to 250°F (120°C). Mix all dry ingredients for rub. Rub ribs with mixture. Wrap in foil. Cook 1.5 hours. Mix BBQ sauce with vinegar and Worcestershire. Unwrap ribs. Brush with sauce. Cook 30 minutes, basting every 10 minutes. Serve hot.
American.chef_tips: The ribs should be tender and falling off the bone. The sauce should be thick and sticky. Don't overcook. Let them rest before serving.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
American.cooking_instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Melt butter in saucepan. Add flour, cook 2 minutes. Add milk gradually, whisk until smooth. Add cheeses, mustard, and cayenne. Cook until melted. Add pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Top with breadcrumbs. Broil until golden. Serve hot.
American.chef_tips: The cheese sauce should be smooth and creamy. Don't overcook the pasta. The top should be golden and crispy. Serve immediately while hot.

American.cooking_instructions: Season wings with salt. Bake at 425°F (220°C) for 25 minutes until crispy. Mix hot sauce, butter, vinegar, garlic powder, and cayenne. Toss wings with sauce. Serve hot with blue cheese dressing.
American.chef_tips: The wings should be crispy and golden. The sauce should be spicy and tangy. Don't overcook. Serve immediately while hot.

American.cooking_instructions: Make pastry: mix flour, sugar, and salt. Cut in butter until crumbly. Add water gradually until dough forms. Chill 30 minutes. Mix apples with sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and flour. Roll out pastry. Line pie pan. Add filling. Cover with top crust. Seal edges. Brush with egg. Bake at 425°F (220°C) for 15 minutes, then 350°F (175°C) for 35 minutes. Cool before serving.
American.chef_tips: The pastry should be flaky and golden. Don't overfill the pie. The apples should be tender but not mushy. Let it cool before slicing.

American.cooking_instructions: Mix dry ingredients. Beat egg with milk and butter. Add to dry ingredients. Mix until just combined. Heat skillet over medium heat. Pour 1/4 cup batter per pancake. Cook until bubbles form. Flip and cook until golden. Serve hot with maple syrup.
American.chef_tips: Don't overmix the batter. The pancakes should be golden and fluffy. Cook over medium heat. Serve immediately while hot.

American.cooking_instructions: Spread hummus on tortillas. Layer vegetables in colorful rows. Add cheese and drizzle with ranch. Roll tightly and cut into pinwheels. Secure with toothpicks if needed.
American.chef_tips: Colorful wraps are fun for kids. Use fresh, crisp vegetables. Cut into bite-sized pieces for easy eating.
American.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange pinwheels in bento box. Add cherry tomatoes on the side. Use colorful silicone dividers.

American.cooking_instructions: Cook macaroni according to package directions. Melt butter, add flour and cook for 1 minute. Add milk and whisk until smooth. Add cheese and stir until melted. Mix with macaroni. Spoon into greased muffin cups. Top with breadcrumbs and oil. Bake at 350°F for 15 minutes.
American.chef_tips: Kids love individual portions. Use mild cheese. Add vegetables for extra nutrition.
American.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange mini cups in bento box. Add steamed broccoli on the side. Decorate with cherry tomatoes.

ingredients: 1/2 cup mixed fruits (strawberries, grapes, pineapple, melon) (80g)
American.cooking_instructions: Cut fruits into bite-sized pieces. Thread onto skewers in colorful patterns. Mix yogurt with honey and vanilla. Serve kabobs with yogurt dip.
American.chef_tips: Colorful fruit kabobs are fun and healthy. Use seasonal fruits. Easy to eat and handle.
American.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange kabobs in bento box. Add yogurt dip in small container. Decorate with mint leaves.

American.cooking_instructions: Mix dry ingredients. Beat egg with milk and oil. Add to dry ingredients. Spoon into greased muffin cups. Top with sauce, cheese, and vegetables. Bake at 375°F for 15-18 minutes.
American.chef_tips: Mini pizzas are perfect for kids. Use mild cheese and vegetables. Let cool before packing.
American.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange mini muffins in bento box. Add marinara sauce in small container. Decorate with fresh basil.

ingredients: 1/2 cup chicken breast, cut into small pieces (60g)
American.cooking_instructions: Mix breadcrumbs with spices. Dredge chicken in flour, then egg, then breadcrumbs. Heat oil in pan and cook until golden brown. Drain on paper towel. Serve with ketchup.
American.chef_tips: Make small bite-sized pieces. Use mild spices. Cook until golden and crispy.
American.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange nuggets in bento box. Add ketchup in small container. Decorate with cherry tomatoes.

American.cooking_instructions: Place cheese and vegetables on one tortilla. Top with second tortilla. Heat oil in pan and cook until golden. Flip and cook other side. Cut into triangles. Serve with salsa.
American.chef_tips: Kids love triangle shapes. Use mild cheese and vegetables. Cook until crispy.
American.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange triangles in bento box. Add salsa in small container. Decorate with cilantro leaves.

American.cooking_instructions: Cut celery into 3-inch sticks. Fill groove with peanut butter. Top with raisins. Mix cream cheese with honey for dip. Serve immediately.
American.chef_tips: Classic kids snack. Use natural peanut butter. Make sure celery is fresh and crisp.
American.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange celery sticks in bento box. Add cream cheese dip in small container. Decorate with extra raisins.

American.cooking_instructions: Mix pancake mix with milk, egg, and butter. Cook small pancakes in pan. Stack with berries between layers. Top with syrup and whipped cream.
American.chef_tips: Make small pancakes for easy eating. Use fresh berries. Stack for fun presentation.
American.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange mini stacks in bento box. Add extra berries on the side. Decorate with mint leaves.

American.cooking_instructions: Cut cheese into small cubes. Arrange crackers with cheese cubes. Add grapes and tomatoes. Serve immediately.
American.chef_tips: Simple and healthy snack. Use mild cheese. Cut everything into bite-sized pieces.
American.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange crackers and cheese in bento box. Add fruits in separate compartments. Decorate with edible flowers.
